text: Ronald Arthur "Ronnie" Biggs (8 August 1929 â€“ 18 December 2013) was a British robber. He is took part in the Great Train Robbery of 1963. The robbery happened on his birthday. Biggs was born in Stockwell, Lambeth, London. He escaped from prison in 1965 and lived as a fugitive for 36 years. In 2001, he chose to return to the United Kingdom and spent the next eight years in prison. Biggs was released from prison on compassionate grounds on 6 August 2009. He died in Barnet, London, aged 84. His cause of death was not released. ==References== ==Other websites== *Biggs' own web site *Guardian photo gallery of Biggs *"The Big One: Ronald Biggs and the Great Train Robbery" , Crime Library *Obituary at the Daily Telegraph Category:1929 births Category:2013 deaths Category:Criminals from London Category:People from the London Borough of Lambeth Category:Disease-related deaths in England Category:Great Train Robbers
title: Ronnie Biggs
